section.title: What is the &alp;?
section.para: The &alp; (ALP) is a lightweight operating system. Instead of applications distributed in traditional software packages, it runs containerized and virtualized workloads.

article.section:
How does the &alp; work?
The &alp; (ALP) consists of the following components:
Base operating system
The core of ALP which runs all required services. It is an immutable operating system with a read-only root file system. The file system is modified by transactional updates which utilize the snapshotting feature of BTRFS.
transactional-update
Container orchestration
ALP runs containerized workloads instead of applications packed in software packages. The orchestrator—for example, &podman;—creates and manages these containers.
The orchestrator manages and runs containers on top of the base OS. These containers contain various workloads, for example applications or a complete development environment. ALP supports several orchestrator types, for example &k3s; or Podman.
